title: ASL 9.6 — Invitations & RSVPs (Polite Ask • Accept/Decline • Close) ✉️
objectives: Make polite invitations using time-first framing and clear details
Accept or decline invitations with natural NMM and short reasons
Close interactions with a clear head-nod/thank-you and optional follow-up

vocab.def: Polite ask with small forward lean + nod.
WHEN before WHAT: e.g., FRIDAY NIGHT → PARTY.
Signals end of exchange; may add FOLLOW-UP.

sections.heading: Warm-Up: Time → Topic → Invite
sections.body: Drill frames: **FRIDAY NIGHT → MOVIE → INVITE YOU PLEASE.** / **SATURDAY AFTERNOON → PICNIC → YOU COME?** Keep clauses 3–5 signs.

sections.heading: Model: Accept / Decline / Maybe

media.alt: Two signers showing accept, decline, maybe
media.caption: Match NMM to response

sections.body:
Accept: **YES CAN. FRIDAY NIGHT OK. THANK-YOU.**  
Decline (brief reason): **SORRY CAN'T. BUSY HOMEWORK. THANK-YOU.**  
Maybe (follow-up): **MAYBE. CHECK SCHEDULE. TEXT LATER.**

sections.heading: Technique: Polite Package
sections.body: For **INVITE** add: small **forward lean**, **nod**, and **PLEASE** (optional). For responses, keep **reason short** (1–2 signs). Finish with **THANK-YOU** or **SEE-YOU**.

callouts.title: Time-Lock
callouts.body: Repeat the time in your response to lock understanding: **FRIDAY NIGHT OK.**

sections.heading: Partner Drill: Invite + RSVP
sections.body: A invites B (time-first). B gives **YES / NO / MAYBE** with matching NMM and short reason if declining. A closes with **THANK-YOU** and optional **FOLLOW-UP** (e.g., **TEXT DETAILS**). Swap roles.

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **20–30s**: Invite someone (time-first), receive an RSVP (accept or decline with short reason), and **close** the exchange with **THANK-YOU** and **FOLLOW-UP** if needed. Caption time, location, and RSVP.

items.q: Which shows a polite decline best?
Why repeat the time in your RSVP?
Gloss an invite and an accept response for: Saturday 6PM → game night.

items.prompt: Which needs practice—time-first invites, NMM for accept/decline, or closing lines? Name one cue you’ll use.

reflectionPrompt: Upload your 20–30s invite + RSVP clip. Caption the time, event, and final decision.
summary: You made time-first invitations, responded with clear accept/decline/maybe using appropriate NMM, and closed the exchange cleanly with a thank-you and optional follow-up.
